fchen

Class VerifiableStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • fchen.VerifiableStorage

  • public class VerifiableStorage
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the protocol which enables a client to check the integrity of the data in the cloud. For the protocol, please refer to our paper. Our papers links two different areas: network coding and cloud storage security.
    Author:
    Chen, Fei (https://sites.google.com/site/chenfeiorange/), First draft on 18-06-2013. License: GNU GPL, Email: chenfeiorange@163.com

      Construct an object handling the protocol execution.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VerifiableStorage

        public VerifiableStorage(java.lang.String originalFile)
        Construct an object handling the protocol execution. The block size is 1KB or 1MB, i.e. n = 1024 or 1024 * 1024.
        Parameters:
        originalFile - Input file name

    • Method Detail

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey()
        Generate the key of the protocol.

      • outsource

        public void outsource()
        Outsource the data that is specified by the input file name.

      • audit

        public ChallengeData audit()
        Generate a challenge to audit the cloud.
        Returns:
        An object containing the indices and coefficients of the data blocks

      • verify

        public boolean verify(ChallengeData challenge,
             ProofData proof)
        Verify whether cloud's answer as in the 'proof' object is correct.
        Parameters:
        challenge - An object containing the challenge data, which is sent from the client
        proof - An object containing the proof data, which is sent by the cloud
        Returns:
        'true' if the cloud is honest; 'false' if the cloud is malicious

      • prove

        public ProofData prove(ChallengeData challenge)
        Generate the proof data on receiving an auditing challenge.
        Parameters:
        challenge - An object containing the challenge information
        Returns:
        An object containing the proof information
